result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvia M. Almaguer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No sentence credit if revoked.
Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Counseling shall specifically include: Anger management / DV counseling. Psychiatric/psychological.Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
*  State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine.
May not have contact with AMA, Estrell T, Johnny T, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvia M. Almaguer

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

1:31 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sylvia M. Almaguer in court.  Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Sylvia M. Almaguer. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 21CF1274/22CF1092. Victim rights compliance. Matter is now resolved and agreement is placed on the record. ADA Tombasco, Attorney Rose and the DE ask to speak with the Court in her chambers on the record. Parties return at 1:35 PM. Appearances are the same.

21CF1274: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to amended count 1 and amended count 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 3-4 are dismissed and read in.
Counts 1-2: Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions. No contact with AMA (D.O.B. 9/17/2005) and Johnny T. and Estrella T.. State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 2 days sentence credit if revoked. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.

22CF1092: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Count 1:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions. No contact with AMA (D.O.B. 9/17/2005) and Johnny T. and Estrella T.. State shall have 60 days to investigate restitution amount for court to determine. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. No sentence credit if revoked. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant in case 21CF1274.

Defendant Sylvia M. Almaguer in court.  Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Sylvia M. Almaguer.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terry William Rose appeared.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  No appearance by DE; Atty states DE called and stated she had Covid. Court tolls time for cause and hearing rescheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sylvia M. Almaguer
Current: 5046 39th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 08-24-2022)
Prior: 2130 25th Street, Kenosha, WI 53140

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  AMA, Johnny T, Estrella T.  No discussion of case w/ Crystal and Latisha M  A, Michael A

109PM    State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 9/8/22 @930am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). Not guilty plea to misd charges. ec
